name: stingy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
unwilling to spend money: He's really stingy and never buys anyone a drink when we go out. The landlords are so stingy - they refused to pay for new carpets. Synonyms
mean (NOT GENEROUS) mainly UK
tight-fisted informal disapproving
small in amount and less than is needed or expected: The problems are linked to stingy government spending over the past decade. The private operators, to earn a profit, have fewer employees with lower pay and stingier benefits. Synonym
meagre
More examplesFewer examplesThe state has been quite stingy with funding for public education.He stated that the world's wealthiest countries were often stingy about donating foreign aid. The prize money certainly isn't stingy.
